ATX.name: ATX
ATX.description: The Austrian Traded Index (ATX) is the most important stock market index of the Wiener Börse and the largest trading place in the Austrian economy. The ATX is, like most European indices, defined as a price index and currently consists of 20 stocks.

AU200.name: ASX 200
AU200.description: The S&P/ASX 200 index is a market-capitalization weighted and float-adjusted stock market index of Australian stocks listed on the Australian Securities Exchange from Standard & Poor's. It was started on 31 March 2000 with a value of 3133.3, equal to the value of the All Ordinaries at that date.

CH30.name: SMI
CH30.description: The Swiss Market Index is Switzerland's blue-chip stock market index, which makes it the most important in the country. It is made up of 20 of the largest and most liquid Swiss Performance Index (SPI) large- and mid-cap stocks.

DAX.name: DAX (German 30)
DAX.description: The DAX is a blue chip stock market index consisting of the 30 major German companies trading on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. The Base date for the DAX is 30 December 1987 and it was started from a base value of 1,000. The Xetra system calculates the index after every 1 second since January 1, 2006.

DOW.name: Dow Jones 30 Industrial
DOW.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is a stock market index. It shows how 30 large, publicly owned companies based in the United States have traded during a standard trading session in the stock market.

ES35.name: IBEX 35
ES35.description: The IBEX 35 (Índice Bursátil Español, literally Spanish Exchange Index) is the benchmark stock market index of the Bolsa de Madrid, Spain's principal stock exchange. It is a market capitalization weighted index comprising the 35 most liquid Spanish stocks traded in the Madrid Stock Exchange General Index and is reviewed twice annually. It was inaugurated on 14 January 1992, where the base value of 3,000 points lies.

EU50.name: Euro Stoxx 50
EU50.description: The EURO STOXX 50 is a stock index of Eurozone stocks designed by STOXX, an index provider owned by Deutsche Börse Group and SIX Group. According to STOXX, its goal is "to provide a blue-chip representation of Supersector leaders in the Eurozone". It is made up of fifty of the largest and most liquid stocks.

FR40.name: CAC 40
FR40.description: The CAC 40 (Cotation Assistée en Continu) is a benchmark French stock market index. The index represents a capitalization-weighted measure of the 40 most significant values among the 100 highest market caps on the Euronext Paris (formerly the Paris Bourse).

HK50.name: Hong Kong 50
HK50.description: Hong Kong 50 is a freefloat-adjusted market capitalization-weighted stock market index in Hong Kong. It is used to record and monitor daily changes of the largest companies of the Hong Kong stock market and is the main indicator of the overall market performance in Hong Kong.

JP225.name: Nikkei 225
JP225.description: The Nikkei 225 is a stock market index for the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE). It has been calculated daily by the Nihon Keizai Shimbun (Nikkei) newspaper since 1950. It is a price-weighted index (the unit is yen), and the components are reviewed once a year.

NDX.name: NASDAQ 100
NDX.description: The NASDAQ-100 is a stock market index made up of 107 equity securities issued by 100 of the largest non-financial companies listed on the NASDAQ. It is a modified capitalization-weighted index.

SP500.name: S&P 500
SP500.description: The S&P 500, is a stock market index based on the common stock prices of 500 top publicly traded American companies, as determined by S&P. It is one of the most commonly followed indices and many consider it the best representation of the market and a bellwether for the U.S. economy.

UK100.name: FTSE 100
UK100.description: This benchmark is maintained by the FTSE Group, a subsidiary of the London Stock Exchange and reflects the share prices of British Blue Chips. It indexes the 100 companies with the highest market capitalization.

AABA.name: Altaba, Inc.
AABA.description: Altaba Inc. is an investment holding corporation that controls a significant interest in Yahoo! Japan and Alibaba. It was created as a result of Verizon's acquisition of Yahoo! Inc's internet business. The company changed its name to Altaba Inc. on June 16, 2017. Verizon completed the acquisition on June 13, 2017. The Yahoo Inc. ticker symbol YHOO was retired in favor of AABA on June 19, 2017.

AAPL.name: Apple, Inc.
AAPL.description: Apple Inc. is an American multinational corporation headquartered in Cupertino, California that designs, develops, and sells consumer electronics, computer software, and personal computers. Its best-known hardware products are the Mac line of computers, the iPod, the iPhone and the iPad.

AMD.name: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.
AMD.description: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD) is an American multinational semiconductor company based in Sunnyvale, California, United States. AMD's main products include microprocessors, motherboard chipsets, embedded processors and graphics processors for servers, workstations and personal computers, and embedded systems applications.

AMZN.name: Amazon.com, Inc.
AMZN.description: Amazon.com, Inc. is an American electronic commerce company with headquarters in Seattle, Washington. It is the largest Internet-based retailer in the United States.

ATVI.name: Activision Blizzard, Inc.
ATVI.description: Activision Blizzard, Inc. is an American video game developer. It is headquartered in Santa Monica, California and was founded in 2008. The company's franchises include Call of Duty, Destiny, Skylanders, World of Warcraft, StarCraft, Diablo, Hearthstone, Heroes of the Storm, and Overwatch, King's Candy Crush Saga, Pet Rescue Saga, and Farm Heroes Saga.

BA.name: The Boeing Company
BA.description: The Boeing Company is an American multinational corporation that designs, manufactures, and sells airplanes, rotorcraft, rockets, and satellites worldwide. Boeing is among the largest global aircraft manufacturers; it is the second-largest defense contractor in the world based on 2015 revenue, and is the largest exporter in the United States by dollar value. The Boeing Company's corporate headquarters are located in Chicago.

BABA.name: Alibaba Group H. Ltd.
BABA.description: Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE: BABA) is a Chinese e-commerce company that provides consumer-to-consumer, business-to-consumer and business-to-business sales services via web portals. It also provides electronic payment services, a shopping search engine and data-centric cloud computing services.

BAC.name: Bank of America Corp.
BAC.description: Bank of America is an American multinational banking and financial services corporation headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina. It is the second largest bank holding company in the United States by assets.

BMW.name: BMW AG
BMW.description: Bayerische Motoren Werke AG, commonly known as BMW or BMW AG, is a German automobile, motorcycle and engine manufacturing company founded in 1916. BMW is headquartered in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. It also owns and produces Mini cars, and is the parent company of Rolls-Royce Motor Cars.

BRKB.name: Berkshire Hathaway, Inc
BRKB.description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. is an American multinational conglomerate holding company headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, United States. The company is known for its control and leadership by Warren Buffett. According to the Forbes Global 2000 list and formula, Berkshire Hathaway is the fourth largest public company in the world, and the 9th largest conglomerate by revenue.

C.name: Citigroup, Inc.
C.description: Citigroup Inc. or Citi is an American multinational investment banking and financial services corporation headquartered in Manhattan, New York City. It is one of the largest bank holding company in the US by assets.

CSCO.name: Cisco Systems, Inc.
CSCO.description: Cisco Systems, Inc. is an American multinational corporation headquartered in San Jose, California, that designs, manufactures, and sells networking equipment. The stock was added to the Dow Jones Industrial Average on June 8, 2009, and is also included in the S&P 500 Index, the Russell 1000 Index, NASDAQ-100 Index and the Russell 1000 Growth Stock Index.

DBK.name: Deutsche Bank AG
DBK.description: Deutsche Bank AG is a German global banking and financial services company with its headquarters in the Deutsche Bank Twin Towers in Frankfurt. It has more than 100,000 employees in over 70 countries, and has a large presence in Europe, the Americas, Asia-Pacific and the emerging markets.

DBX.name: Dropbox Inc.
DBX.description: Dropbox, Inc., headquartered in San Francisco, California, offers cloud storage, file synchronization, personal cloud, and client software. Dropbox was founded in 2007, by MIT students Drew Houston and Arash Ferdowsi, as a startup company, with initial funding from seed accelerator Y Combinator.

DIS.name: The Walt Disney Company
DIS.description: The Walt Disney Company, commonly known as Disney, is an American diversified multinational mass media and entertainment conglomerate, headquartered at the Walt Disney Studios in Burbank, California. Disney was founded on October 16, 1923 – by brothers Walt Disney and Roy O. Disney – as the Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio, and established itself as a leader in the American animation industry before diversifying into live-action film production, television, and theme parks.

F.name: Ford Motor Comp.
F.description: The Ford Motor Company is an American multinational automaker headquartered in Dearborn, Michigan, a suburb of Detroit. It was founded by Henry Ford and incorporated on June 16, 1903. The company sells automobiles and commercial vehicles under the Ford brand and most luxury cars under the Lincoln brand.

FB.name: Facebook, Inc.
FB.description: Facebook, Inc. is an American multinational Internet corporation which runs the social networking website Facebook. Facebook Inc. began selling stock to the public and trading on the NASDAQ on May 18, 2012.

GOOG.name: Alphabet, Inc.
GOOG.description: Alphabet Inc. (commonly known as Alphabet, and frequently informally referred to as Google) is an American multinational conglomerate created in 2015 as the parent company of Google and several other companies previously owned by Google. Some of its subsidiaries include Google, Calico, GV, Google Capital, X, and Google Fiber.

GPRO.name: GoPro, Inc.
GPRO.description: GoPro, Inc. (formerly Woodman Labs, Inc), an American corporation that develops, manufactures and markets high-definition personal cameras, often used in extreme-action video photography. They are compact, lightweight, rugged, and are wearable or mountable on vehicles. The company has its base in San Mateo, California.

INTC.name: Intel Corporation
INTC.description: Intel Corporation is an American multinational corporation headquartered in Santa Clara, California. Intel is one of the world's largest and highest valued semiconductor chip makers, based on revenue. It is the inventor of the x86 series of microprocessors, the processors found in most personal computers.

KO.name: Coca-Cola
KO.description: The Coca-Cola Company is an American multinational beverage corporation and manufacturer, retailer, and marketer of nonalcoholic beverage concentrates and syrups, which is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. The company is best known for its flagship product Coca-Cola, invented in 1886 by pharmacist John Stith Pemberton in Columbus, Georgia.

LHA.name: Deutsche Lufthansa AG
LHA.description: Deutsche Lufthansa AG is the largest German airline and, when combined with its subsidiaries, also the largest airline in Europe, in terms of fleet size, and the second largest airline in terms of passengers carried during 2016. Lufthansa's registered office and corporate headquarters are in Cologne. The main operations base is at Lufthansa's primary hub at Frankfurt Airport.

MSFT.name: Microsoft Corp.
MSFT.description: Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational corporation headquartered in Redmond, Washington that develops, manufactures, licenses and supports a wide range of products and services related to computing. The company was founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen on April 4, 1975.

NFLX.name: Netflix, Inc.
NFLX.description: Netflix, Inc. is a provider of on-demand Internet streaming. The company was established in 1997 and is headquartered in Los Gatos, California. As of September 2014, Netflix has subscribers in over 40 countries, with intentions of expanding their services in unreached countries.

NVDA.name: NVIDIA Corp.
NVDA.description: Nvidia Corporation is an American technology company based in Santa Clara, California. It designs graphics processing units (GPUs) for the gaming and professional markets, as well as system on a chip units (SoCs) for the mobile computing and automotive market.

PEP.name: PepsiCo, Inc.
PEP.description: PepsiCo Inc. is an American multinational food and beverage corporation headquartered in Purchase, New York, United States, with interests in the manufacturing, marketing and distribution of grain-based snack foods, beverages, and other products.  PepsiCo was formed in 1965 with the merger of the Pepsi-Cola Company and Frito-Lay, Inc.

SIE.name: Siemens AG
SIE.description: Siemens AG is a German conglomerate company headquartered in Berlin and Munich and the largest industrial manufacturing company in Europe with branch offices abroad. The principal divisions of the company are Industry, Energy, Healthcare (Siemens Healthineers), and Infrastructure & Cities, which represent the main activities of the company.

SNAP.name: Snap, Inc.
SNAP.description: Snap Inc. is an American multinational technology and social media company, founded on September 16, 2011 by Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy and based in Venice, Los Angeles. Its products include Snapchat and Spectacles, as well as the Bitmoji app.

SPOT.name: Spotify Technology S.A.
SPOT.description: Spotify is a music, podcast, and video streaming service launched on 7th October 2008. It is developed by Spotify AB in Stockholm, Sweden. It provides DRM-protected content from record labels and media companies. Spotify is a freemium service; basic features are free with advertisements or limitations, while additional features are offered via paid subscriptions.

TSLA.name: Tesla Motors, Inc.
TSLA.description: Tesla Motors, Inc. is an American company that designs, manufactures, and sells electric cars and electric vehicle powertrain components. Tesla first gained widespread attention following their production of the Tesla Roadster, the first fully electric sports car

TWTR.name: Twitter, Inc.
TWTR.description: Twitter is an online social networking service. It was created in March 2006 by Jack Dorsey, Evan Williams, Biz Stone and Noah Glass and launched by July 2006. The service rapidly gained worldwide popularity. In 2013 Twitter was one of the ten most-visited websites, and has been described as "the SMS of the Internet."

TWX.name: Time Warner, Inc.
TWX.description: Time Warner, Inc. is an American multinational mass media and entertainment conglomerate headquartered in New York City. Time Warner was first founded in 1990, with the merger of Time Inc. and Warner Communications. The current company consists largely of the assets of the former Warner Communications (as well as HBO, a Time Inc. subsidiary prior to the merger), and the assets of Turner Broadcasting.

V.name: Visa, Inc.
V.description: Visa Inc. is an American multinational financial services corporation headquartered in Foster City, California, United States. It facilitates electronic funds transfers throughout the world, most commonly through Visa-branded credit cards and debit cards.

VOW3.name: Volkswagen AG
VOW3.description: Volkswagen Group, shortly VW AG, and its subsidiaries, is a German multinational automotive manufacturing company headquartered in Wolfsburg, Lower Saxony, Germany. It designs, manufactures and distributes passenger and commercial vehicles, motorcycles, engines, and turbomachinery and offers related services including financing, leasing and fleet management.

WMT.name: Wal-Mart Stores, Inc.
WMT.description: Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., doing business as Walmart, is an American multinational retailing corporation that operates as a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores. Headquartered in Bentonville, Arkansas, the company was founded by Sam Walton in 1962 and incorporated on October 31, 1969. On January 31, 2017, Walmart had 11,695 stores and clubs in 28 countries, under a total of 63 banners.

WU.name: Western Union
WU.description: The Western Union Company is an American financial services and communications company. Its North American headquarters is in Meridian, Colorado, though the postal designation of nearby Englewood is used in its mailing address. Up until it discontinued the service in 2006, Western Union was the best-known U.S. company in the business of exchanging telegrams.

GOLD.name: Gold 1 oz
GOLD.description: Gold has been a valuable and highly sought-after precious metal for coinage, jewelry, and other arts long before the beginning of recorded history. Gold standards have been the most common basis for monetary policies throughout human history, being widely supplanted by fiat currency starting in the 1930s.

HG.name: Copper
HG.description: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. It is used as a conductor of heat and electricity, as a building material, and as a constituent of various metal alloys, such as sterling silver used in jewelry, cupronickel used to make marine hardware and coins, and constantan used in strain gauges and thermocouples for temperature measurement.

NG.name: Natural Gas
NG.description: Natural gas is a naturally occurring hydrocarbon gas mixture consisting primarily of methane. It is formed when layers of decomposing plant and animal matter are exposed to intense heat and pressure under the surface of the Earth over millions of years. The energy that the plants originally obtained from the sun is stored in the form of chemical bonds in the gas.

OILWTI.name: Crude Oil (WTI)
OILWTI.description: West Texas Intermediate (WTI), also known as Texas light sweet, is a grade of crude oil used as a benchmark in oil pricing. This grade is described as light because of its relatively low density, and sweet because of its low sulfur content.

SILVER.name: Silver 1 oz
SILVER.description: Silver is a metallic chemical element which has the highest electrical conductivity and the highest thermal conductivity of any metal. Silver has long been valued as a precious metal, and it is used as an investment, to make ornaments, jewelry, high-value tableware, utensils, electrical conductors, mirrors and currency coins.

AUDNZD.name: AUD/NZD
AUDNZD.description: This is the exchange rate between the Australian dollar, the currency of the Commonwealth of Australia, and the New Zealand dollar, the currency of the Realm of New Zealand.

AUDUSD.name: AUD/USD
AUDUSD.description: This is the exchange rate between the Australian dollar, the currency of the Commonwealth of Australia, and the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America.

EURAUD.name: EUR/AUD
EURAUD.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone and the Australian Dollar, the currency of the Commonwealth of Australia.

EURCAD.name: EUR/CAD
EURCAD.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone and the Canadian Dollar, the official currency of Canada.

EURCHF.name: EUR/CHF
EURCHF.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the franc (code: CHF), the currency and legal tender of Switzerland and Liechtenstein.

EURGBP.name: EUR/GBP
EURGBP.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the pound sterling (code: GBP), the official currency of the United Kingdom.

EURJPY.name: EUR/JPY
EURJPY.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the Japanese yen (code: JPY), the official currency of Japan.

EURNOK.name: EUR/NOK
EURNOK.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the krone, the currency of Norway and its dependent territories.

EURSEK.name: EUR/SEK
EURSEK.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the krona, the official currency of Sweden.

EURTRY.name: EUR/TRY
EURTRY.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the Turkish lira, the currency of Turkey and the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.

EURUSD.name: EUR/USD
EURUSD.description: This is the exchange rate between the Euro, the official currency of the Eurozone, and the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America.

GBPUSD.name: GBP/USD
GBPUSD.description: This is the exchange rate between the pound sterling (code: GBP), the official currency of the United Kingdom, and the U.S. Dollar, the official currency of the United States of America.

NZDUSD.name: NZD/USD
NZDUSD.description: This is the exchange rate between the New Zealand dollar, the currency of the Realm of New Zealand, and the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America.

USDCAD.name: USD/CAD
USDCAD.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America, and the Canadian dollar, the official currency of Canada.

USDCHF.name: USD/CHF
USDCHF.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the franc (code: CHF), the currency and legal tender of Switzerland and Liechtenstein.

USDCNH.name: USD/CNH
USDCNH.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the renminbi is the official currency of the People's Republic of China. The yuan is the basic unit of the renminbi.

USDHKD.name: USD/HKD
USDHKD.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. Dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the Hong Kong Dollar, the official currency of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

USDJPY.name: USD/JPY
USDJPY.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the Japanese yen (code: JPY), the official currency of Japan.

USDMXN.name: USD/MXN
USDMXN.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the Mexican peso, the currency of Mexico.

USDRUB.name: USD/RUB
USDRUB.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the ruble (code: RUB), the official currency of Russia and the two partially recognized republics of Abkhazia and South Ossetia.

USDTRY.name: USD/TRY
USDTRY.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the Turkish lira, the currency of Turkey and the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.

USDZAR.name: USD/ZAR
USDZAR.description: This is the exchange rate between the U.S. Dollar, the official currency of the United States of America and the South African Rand, the official currency of South Africa.

BTCUSD.name: BTC/USD
BTCUSD.description: *** NOTE: This market was moved to 1fox.com and is in watch-only mode on 1Broker. ***
